item.title: Edmundo González, likely winner of Venezuela election, flees to Spain
item.dc:creator: María Luisa Paúl, Niha Masih, Samantha Schmidt
item.description: González fled days after the attorney general for Venezuela’s authoritarian president, Nicolás Maduro, filed a warrant for the arrest of the former diplomat.

item.title: Philippine celebrity pastor arrested in human trafficking, sex crime case
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Sammy Westfall
item.description: Philippine police have captured Apollo Quiboloy, the Kingdom of Jesus Christ megachurch founder who is also wanted by the FBI on charges of sex and human trafficking.

item.title: Gunman kills 3 Israelis in rare attack at border crossing with Jordan
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Annabelle Timsit, Niha Masih
item.description: The shooting by a Jordanian gunman at the Allenby Bridge was the deadliest on record at the border crossing. In response, Israel shut down land crossings with Jordan.

item.title: China’s ‘disappeared’ foreign minister demoted to low-level publishing job, say former U.S. officials
item.dc:creator: Ellen Nakashima, Christian Shepherd
item.description: Qin Gang, an aggressive “wolf warrior” diplomat, had a meteoric rise and an even faster fall from grace. He’s now said to be taking a salary at a Beijing state-run bookseller.

item.title: They promised to stop practicing female cutting. This sleuth makes sure.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Chason
item.description: Momodou Keita is back on patrol after his work triggered a debate over female genital mutilation that convulsed Gambia and drew broad international attention.

item.title: Russia throttles YouTube, popular with kids, celebrities and dissidents
item.dc:creator: Mary Ilyushina
item.description: Russia is cracking down on alternative sources of information, especially online, and is pushing citizens away from foreign-based social media apps.

item.title: Typhoon Yagi leaves four dead, dozens injured in Vietnam
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The “super typhoon” shuttered airports and wreaked havoc on roads in Hanoi and surrounding areas in northern Vietnam.

item.title: Palestinians interview witnesses to U.S. woman’s West Bank killing
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Susannah George, Adela Suliman, Mohamad El Chamaa, Andrew Jeong
item.description: Two witnesses said Aysenur Eygi, 26, was shot in the head by Israeli forces. Eyewitnesses said evidence gathering was underway after Eygi’s death.

item.title: CIA chief says Ukraine’s incursion into Russia unnerved Moscow elites
item.dc:creator: Greg Miller
item.description: CIA Director William J. Burns made the remarks Saturday during a rare public appearance with his British counterpart, Richard Moore, in London.

item.title: Paris to name sports venue in honor of slain Olympian Rebecca Cheptegei
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall
item.description: The Ugandan marathoner was set on fire in Kenya by her ex-partner, police allege. “Paris will not forget her,” its mayor said, according to AFP.

item.title: Ukraine’s Kursk incursion already has its own museum exhibit in Kyiv
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady, Serhiy Morgunov
item.description: The museum director crossed into Russia days after Ukrainian troops and brought back a haul of items to portray a “picture of the war.”
